alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 27 at 3:07PM EST until March 01 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...LOW PRESSURE TO BRING ACCUMULATING SNOW TO THE REGION TONIGHT AND TUESDAY... .An area of low pressure is expected to move from the Great Lakes on Monday and then across New England Monday night into Tuesday before pulling away from the region Tuesday night. Snow is expected to overspread the region from the late Monday evening into the nighttime hours and continue through the day on Tuesday before tapering off Tuesday night. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TUESDAY TO 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches. * WHERE...Central Somerset County. * WHEN...From 7 AM Tuesday to 7 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
